intro: Guapira, commonly known as the Brazilian whitebeam, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species native to South America, particularly Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. Guapira species typically grow in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and floral display.
